  • test_docstring_parsing
  • test_check_with_method
  • test_validator_method
  • test_schema_validation_can_be_disabled_in_schema_setter
   1 # -*- coding: utf-8 -*-
   2 
   3 from pytest import mark
   4 
   5 import cerberus
   6 from cerberus.tests import assert_fail, assert_success
   7 from cerberus.tests.conftest import sample_schema
   8 
   9 
  10 def test_contextual_data_preservation():
  11     class InheritedValidator(cerberus.Validator):
  12         def __init__(self, *args, **kwargs):
  13             if 'working_dir' in kwargs:
  14                 self.working_dir = kwargs['working_dir']
  15             super(InheritedValidator, self).__init__(*args, **kwargs)
  16 
  17         def _validate_type_test(self, value):
  18             if self.working_dir:
  19                 return True
  20 
  21     assert 'test' in InheritedValidator.types
  22     v = InheritedValidator(
  23         {'test': {'type': 'list', 'schema': {'type': 'test'}}}, working_dir='/tmp'
  24     )
  25     assert_success({'test': ['foo']}, validator=v)
  26 
  27 
  28 def test_docstring_parsing():
  29     class CustomValidator(cerberus.Validator):
  30         def _validate_foo(self, argument, field, value):
  31             """ {'type': 'zap'} """
  32             pass
  33 
  34         def _validate_bar(self, value):
  35             """ Test the barreness of a value.
  36 
  37             The rule's arguments are validated against this schema:
  38                 {'type': 'boolean'}
  39             """
  40             pass
  41 
  42     assert 'foo' in CustomValidator.validation_rules
  43     assert 'bar' in CustomValidator.validation_rules
  44 
  45 
  46 # TODO remove 'validator' as rule parameter with the next major release
  47 @mark.parametrize('rule', ('check_with', 'validator'))
  48 def test_check_with_method(rule):
  49     # https://github.com/pyeve/cerberus/issues/265
  50     class MyValidator(cerberus.Validator):
  51         def _check_with_oddity(self, field, value):
  52             if not value & 1:
  53                 self._error(field, "Must be an odd number")
  54 
  55     v = MyValidator(schema={'amount': {rule: 'oddity'}})
  56     assert_success(document={'amount': 1}, validator=v)
  57     assert_fail(
  58         document={'amount': 2},
  59         validator=v,
  60         error=('amount', (), cerberus.errors.CUSTOM, None, ('Must be an odd number',)),
  61     )
  62 
  63 
  64 # TODO remove test with the next major release
  65 @mark.parametrize('rule', ('check_with', 'validator'))
  66 def test_validator_method(rule):
  67     class MyValidator(cerberus.Validator):
  68         def _validator_oddity(self, field, value):
  69             if not value & 1:
  70                 self._error(field, "Must be an odd number")
  71 
  72     v = MyValidator(schema={'amount': {rule: 'oddity'}})
  73     assert_success(document={'amount': 1}, validator=v)
  74     assert_fail(
  75         document={'amount': 2},
  76         validator=v,
  77         error=('amount', (), cerberus.errors.CUSTOM, None, ('Must be an odd number',)),
  78     )
  79 
  80 
  81 def test_schema_validation_can_be_disabled_in_schema_setter():
  82     class NonvalidatingValidator(cerberus.Validator):
  83         """
  84         Skips schema validation to speed up initialization
  85         """
  86 
  87         @cerberus.Validator.schema.setter
  88         def schema(self, schema):
  89             if schema is None:
  90                 self._schema = None
  91             elif self.is_child:
  92                 self._schema = schema
  93             elif isinstance(schema, cerberus.schema.DefinitionSchema):
  94                 self._schema = schema
  95             else:
  96                 self._schema = cerberus.schema.UnvalidatedSchema(schema)
  97 
  98     v = NonvalidatingValidator(schema=sample_schema)
  99     assert v.validate(document={'an_integer': 1})
 100     assert not v.validate(document={'an_integer': 'a'})
